skill.name: payload
skill.description: Use when working with Payload CMS projects (payload.config.ts, collections, fields, hooks, access control, Payload API). Use when debugging validation errors, security issues, relationship queries, transactions, or hook behavior.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns were found in the skill files. Content is documentation and examples only.

content.value_statement: Payload configuration can be complex and easy to misconfigure. This skill gives direct guidance for collections, fields, hooks, access control, and queries.
actual_capabilities: Explain collection configuration patterns including auth, uploads, drafts, and live preview
Provide field type guidance and safe usage of field type guards
Describe hook behavior patterns and common pitfalls like loops
Clarify access control patterns, including Local API overrideAccess rules
Outline query operators and relationship query patterns
Summarize adapter, endpoint, and plugin development patterns
limitations: Does not run or validate code in your project
Relies on provided context and bundled references only
Does not generate or modify files automatically
Cannot verify runtime configuration or database state

use_cases.title: Design a secure collection
use_cases.description: Get help setting access control and hook patterns for a collection with drafts and permissions.

use_cases.title: Fix a query bug
use_cases.description: Find the correct query operator, depth usage, and relationship filters for a Payload API call.

use_cases.title: Plan a plugin structure
use_cases.description: Review plugin architecture, hooks extension, and field injection patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Create a basic collection
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner needs a simple posts collection
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Payload collection for posts with title, slug, status, and author fields. Include defaults and admin columns.

prompt_templates.title: Add drafts and access
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to enable drafts and add access control so public reads only published posts.

prompt_templates.title: Prevent hook loops
prompt_templates.prompt: I have an afterChange hook that updates the same doc. How do I avoid infinite loops using context flags?

prompt_templates.title: Advanced access pattern
prompt_templates.scenario: Advanced time or role based access
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a read access function that allows editors to see all content and public users only published content within a date range.

output_examples.input: Explain how to enforce access control for Local API operations.
output: Local API bypasses access control by default
Pass overrideAccess: false when acting for a user
Keep overrideAccess: true for trusted system tasks

best_practices: Set overrideAccess: false when performing user scoped Local API operations
Thread req through nested operations to keep transactions atomic
Add context flags to prevent hooks from triggering themselves
anti_patterns: Assuming Local API respects user permissions without overrideAccess: false
Running nested operations in hooks without passing req
Writing hooks that update the same document without a guard

faq.question: Is this compatible with Payload 3.x and Next.js?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets Payload 3.x patterns and Next.js native CMS usage.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not run code or inspect your repository. It provides guidance from bundled references.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my project setup?
faq.answer: It can adapt advice to your config when you share details, but it does not modify files.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. The skill content is static documentation and examples without data access.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot a failing hook?
faq.answer: Share the hook code and error details. You will get guidance on context, req usage, and loop prevention.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic CMS help?
faq.answer: It focuses on Payload specific APIs, config patterns, and common pitfalls.
